q: Salmon, a former Democrat turned Republican, told POLITICO that first-term independent Sen. Bernie Sanders is ''closer to meeting a challenge'' and that he's undeterred by the long odds of a successful bid. Right now, I am 65 percent in. When I hit 75 percent it will commence exploratory. I plan to continue to listen to diverse groups, reflect, and ensure it is the right thing to do for self, family, state and country, said Salmon. ''I am not attached to the 2012 outcome, my odds, or my political career. I don't need to be senator, or governor, or stay put as state auditor

the Nokia ''sand Microsoft's CEOs said they believe that a partnership will leverage the two companies' core competencies-- Microsoft's software and Nokia's hardware and distribution-- to win in the smartphone space. The partnership announced today provides incredible scale, vast expertise in hardware and software innovation and a proven ability to execute, said Steve Ballmer , Microsoft''s CEO, who also appeared at the London conference. Goodbye Symbian and Intel, hello Windows Nokia has forever put its own smartphone operating system, Symbian, on its devices.

This is what Tom Watson, the former Labour minister who has led the charge against Andy Coulson as a member of the Commons culture committee, said: This is the second job that Andy Coulson has resigned from for something he claims to know nothing about. His departure creates serious questions over the prime minister's judgment and points to the need for a deeper investigation into the affairs of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp.
